node.title: As David Warner faces a fitness test, here's everything you need to know ahead of the Adelaide clash
node.alt: David Warner shouts after playing a shot while batting in an Ashes Test against England at the Gabba.
node.description: David Warner is facing a race against the clock to be fit for the Adelaide Test. Here's everything you need to know ahead of the first ball on Thursday.
node.content:
["Nothing says a home\u00a0Ashes series more than a rout at the Gabba in the first Test, and while we saw a very brief fightback from Joe Root and Dawid Malan, it was business as usual in Brisbane.", "Romping home to a nine-wicket victory, Australia\u00a0dominated from the first ball\u00a0as Mitchell Starc created one of the most memorable moments in recent Ashes history by bowling Rory Burns around his legs in front of a roaring crowd.", "Now it's on to Adelaide and the pink ball Test. Can Australia go up 2-0 in the series?", "ABC Grandstand will have you covered throughout the entire series with Jim Maxwell, Jonathan Agnew, Andrew Moore and Quentin Hull calling the action, while Ian Chappell, Kristen Beams, Mitchell Johnson and Steven Finn will be on board as experts.", "The ABC Sport team will also be blogging every day of the action\u00a0with Simon Smale and\u00a0Dean Bilton\u00a0leading the way.", "The series will be broadcast on TV through Channel 7 and Foxtel, and can be streamed through Kayo Sports.", "Play gets\u00a0underway at\u00a02.30pm in South Australia, which is 3pm\u00a0in Victoria,\u00a0New South Wales and Tasmania,\u00a02pm in Queensland, 1:30pm\u00a0in the Northern Territory, and\u00a012pm\u00a0in Western Australia. For those of you in the UK, that's 4am your time.", "", "
Shaun Marsh celebrates after scoring a century during the 2017 Adelaide Test.(AAP: Dave Hunt)
", "From the eight\u00a0Tests Australia has played under lights, the Aussies have come away with eight victories.", "On the flip side, England has just\u00a0one victory in day-night Tests, and it came way back in 2017 against the West Indies.\u00a0", "The last time England played in the Adelaide pink ball Test, in 2017, they lost by 120 runs, which was actually the closest they got the Aussies throughout the entire series.\u00a0", "Having declared at 8-442 in the first innings following an unbeaten 126 from Shaun Marsh, England was skittled for 227 with Nathan Lyon claiming best figures of 4-60.", "Australia went back in with a lead of 215, but could only manage an extra 138 runs\u00a0 as James Anderson and Chris Woakes tag teamed the Aussie batting order, taking 5-43 and 4-36 respectively.", "Needing 353 to win, Joe Root held things together with a strong 67, but Mitchell Starc took five crucial wickets as the English managed just 233.", "", "
Josh Hazlewood is out of the Adelaide Test with a side strain.(AAP: Dave Hunt)
", "Josh Hazlewood is the confirmed omission for Australia as he battles a side strain injury picked up in the Brisbane Test. He looks set to be replaced by Jhye Richardson, although Michael Neser is another option to come in.", "David Warner is also in some doubt\u00a0with a rib injury, however the veteran opener completed a nets session\u00a0 on Tuesday that could be enough to prove he is right to go. Should Warner miss, Usman Khawaja is an option to open despite a lean showing for Australia A last week, while uncapped Bryce Street is on the brink of being added to the squad after an unbeaten 119 in the same match.", "For England, Anderson and Stuart Broad are set to come in after being rested in Brisbane, although coach Chris Silverwood stopped short of confirming their selection.", "\"We're lucky we've got two England greats in Broad and Anderson, so we've got a wealth of experience,\" he said.", "\"Jimmy will be fit and ready to go for the second Test, as will Stuart. Yes, they are available. Certainly, from an experience point of view, with the bowlers we've got heaps of experience so I'm happy with that.\"", "Should they come in, spinner Jack Leach appears to be on the chopping block, with Ollie Robinson or Woakes also potential omissions.", "Australia:\u00a0Pat Cummins (c), Steve Smith (vc), Alex Carey, Cameron Green, Josh Hazlewood, Marcus Harris, Travis Head, Usman Khawaja, Marnus Labuschagne, Nathan Lyon, Michael Neser, Jhye Richardson, Mitchell Starc, Mitchell Swepson, David Warner", "England:\u00a0Joe Root (c), James Anderson, Jonathan Bairstow, Dom Bess, Stuart Broad, Rory Burns, Jos Buttler, Zak Crawley, Haseeb Hameed, Dan Lawrence, Jack Leach, Dawid Malan, Craig Overton, Ollie Pope, Ollie Robinson, Ben Stokes, Chris Woakes, Mark Wood", "While the heavens opened up in Brisbane \u2014 mercifully for the most part outside of playing hours \u2014 Adelaide is set to be typically dry throughout with just a 5 per cent chance of rain each day from Friday to Monday.", "When is the third Ashes Test?", "Next cab off the rank is the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, starting on December 26, followed by the Sydney Test on January 5, then the Hobart Test on January 14.", "The start of the Adelaide Test marks 15 years to the day that Adam Gilchrist unloaded on the English bowlers to score the second-fastest century in Test history. But who held the record for the fastest Test century at the time? Find out here."]
